name: Tomato Chutney
history: Tomato Chutney is a popular condiment in Indian cuisine, known for its tangy and spicy flavor. It's a versatile accompaniment that pairs well with many Indian dishes like dosas, idlis, and chapatis. Each region in India has its own version of this chutney.
description: Tomato Chutney is a tangy and spicy condiment made with tomatoes, onions, and a variety of spices. It's a staple in Indian households and is often prepared fresh. This chutney adds a flavorful kick to meals and snacks.

instructions.title: Sauté Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and garlic. Once the mustard seeds start to crackle, add onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn translucent.

instructions.title: Cook Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add the chopped tomatoes and salt to the pan. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.

instructions.title: Blend the Mixture
instructions.description: Allow the mixture to cool. Then, blend it to a smooth consistency, adding a little water if needed.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Tomato Chutney with your favorite Indian snacks or meals.

tips: Adjust the number of green chilies to control the spice level.
Adding a small piece of tamarind can enhance the tanginess of the chutney.
variations: Include a handful of fresh coriander leaves for a refreshing taste.
For a sweeter version, add a small amount of jaggery or sugar.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: If needed, gently reheat the chutney in a pan over low heat.

presentationTips: Garnish with fresh curry leaves or coriander before serving.
Serve in a colorful ceramic bowl to enhance the visual appeal.
